H0.text: Parasitism will most likely increase when a bird species that also eats small rodents is introduced into an ecosystem where a snake species already eats small rodents.

H1.text: Migration will most likely increase in the ecosystem when a bird species is introduced that also eats small rodents, competing with the existing snake species that preys on those rodents.

H2.text: Mutualism is most likely to increase when a bird species that also eats small rodents is introduced into an ecosystem where a snake species already feeds on small rodents.

H3.text: Competition will most likely increase when a bird species that also eats small rodents is introduced into an ecosystem where a snake species already eats small rodents.

A4.text: Interspecific competition may occur when individuals of two separate species share a limiting resource in the same area.

A5.text: Both species feed on similar prey, they are negatively impacted by the presence of the other because they will have less food.
